channel.title: Best way to run the server processes?
channel.description:
I''m confused on what "should" be the be the best way to execute the processes in a rsps. I've seen a few methods now, the Java util.timer is Yz's way, and was mine for a while, I also saw Grahm's Event Manager, which, in all else was nice. Also there is the shitty 500ms abstract boolean process(), which, we all know we shouldn't use.
I want to try and experiment with some sort of method, but I'm not sure what exactly to try and implement.
I'm thinking of a timer with a clean and exit object escape, for example, attacking. We don't want to loop through attacking forever, so, just create an instance while we want to attack, and then destroy it.
Do you think this would be effective?
